channel.title: Am I In Over My Head?
channel.description:
Well, wow, this is my third topic in like, 15 minutes.. Haha.
Well, I made this topic too ask if I was in way over my head. Basically, I'll sum it up. I'm starting to think motocross is too hard for me. I don't want to end up in a wheelchair or a cofin like so many people do from the sport. A little story from Motocross Action Magazine (A magazine I buy) "2 days after Daniel won the world championships, he was cut down in his prime." Or: "David Bailey was a phenomenal rider. The best the world had every seen at his era. But the hero was injured severely in a practice crash. A little 3 feet jump, isn't much right? Wrong. It was enough to end the career of the hero, and confine him to a wheelchair."
I guess what I'm asking is. Do you think I'm kidding myself doing this? There's only 5 people in the world that make a living in the sport. The other 55 pay there bills and buy and work on their bikes themselves.
I'm starting to think about go MotoGP. And hope I could fulfill Casey Stoner's shoes ones day. Or Mick Doohan.
What do you think?

go get degrees and work your ass off like everyone else

item.title: Am I In Over My Head?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“nator123123, post:22, topic:123698”][quote author=PaulT link=topic=173499.msg1600537#msg1600537 date=1184570955]
If you have to ask yourself “Am I too much of a pussy for this sport?” then you’re too much of a pussy.
[/quote]
There’s your answer.
Some of these topics like these are posted to gain attention.
For probably everything, if you think you can do it, you surely can.[/quote]
Oh okay… So I think I can be the best coder overnight, will it happen? No.
Wake up to yourself… Thinking you can do it does not mean you can.

Read full topic
item.source: Am I In Over My Head?

item.title: Am I In Over My Head?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:20, topic:123698”][quote author=daycrawler link=topic=173499.msg1607640#msg1607640 date=1184756765]
It’s apparent that you don’t love your sport then you should quit. Your a quitter. If you keep this up then you won’t amount to anything. Pain is what makes the sport/game fun. Without pain/hard work and sacrifice then life has no meaning.
[/quote]
Calling me a quitter is not right. I love riding, but do you know how hard it is?
Ask Buzzy, a ex-racer. He can back me up about how dangerous it is, and how psychically hard it is.
This might sound weird, but, I don’t want to end up with the rest of my life fucked like my friend…
All my friends ride, but I am better then all of them. So if my friend was hurt, what’s stopping me from being mangled in an accident?[/quote]

Well then go ahead and quit,if your only going to talk about how bad it is…I dont see the fun in motocross as in other sports…But that is my opinion,so hopefully you wont flame me saying how much fun it is and how stupid I sound.

Read full topic
item.source: Am I In Over My Head?

item.title: Am I In Over My Head?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

daycrawler:

It’s apparent that you don’t love your sport then you should quit. Your a quitter. If you keep this up then you won’t amount to anything. Pain is what makes the sport/game fun. Without pain/hard work and sacrifice then life has no meaning.

Calling me a quitter is not right. I love riding, but do you know how hard it is?
Ask Buzzy, a ex-racer. He can back me up about how dangerous it is, and how psychically hard it is.
This might sound weird, but, I don’t want to end up with the rest of my life fucked like my friend…
All my friends ride, but I am better then all of them. So if my friend was hurt, what’s stopping me from being mangled in an accident?

Read full topic

item.title: Am I In Over My Head?
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:15, topic:123698”][quote author=Casey. link=topic=173499.msg1607541#msg1607541 date=1184754810]
I have a story also.

I was biking also, this kid suddenly curved infront of me, cause me to hit him, me to fly over my bike landing head first into the dirt.
I lost several teeh, broke my nose/jaw.

It’s a bit dangrous
[/quote]
A broken nose/jaw is bad, but in motocross, they’re considered a pussy accident. So is a broken arm, it’s like if you break your arm,
“Oh hey I can ride in 5 weeks”[/quote]

Yea but with a broken arm, its harder to control the bike…

Read full topic

item.title: Am I In Over My Head?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Buzzy:

I used to do it. Suzuki ftw =) but anyways, I quit because my friend broke his neck in a race I was in. I remember afterwards, watching him get carried away was just to much. I mean, yeah, he recovered but I still never wanted that to happen to me. I mean… Your young… Want to fuck up the rest of your life?

I am so glad, someone here knows how it feels. My friend hasn’t recovered. He is paralyzed. And you know what it’s like to be a racer, everytime you line up to that gate you risk your life.

Read full topic
item.source: Am I In Over My Head?

item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:4, topic:123698”]Yz, I’d have to say personally I wouldn’t do motocross. The dangers are too high for the potential gain. But it’s your choice. Don’t let fear stop you. If you are passionate about it, do it.

Your last name is Stoner?

Twas a bad joke.[/quote]
But, it can be a great sport. Noone is an asshole too each other, except on the track, then it’s all agro. Bumping into each other, ramming each other, pushing people off the track…



Is why motocross is a shit of a sport.


Is why it’s the best sport ever. For that moment.

Read full topic

item.title: Am I In Over My Head?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Well, wow, this is my third topic in like, 15 minutes… Haha.

Well, I made this topic too ask if I was in way over my head. Basically, I’ll sum it up. I’m starting to think motocross is too hard for me.
I don’t want to end up in a wheelchair or a cofin like so many people do from the sport.
A little story from Motocross Action Magazine (A magazine I buy)
“2 days after Daniel won the world championships, he was cut down in his prime.”
Or:
“David Bailey was a phenomenal rider. The best the world had every seen at his era. But the hero was injured severely in a practice crash. A little 3 feet jump, isn’t much right? Wrong. It was enough to end the career of the hero, and confine him to a wheelchair.”

I guess what I’m asking is. Do you think I’m kidding myself doing this? There’s only 5 people in the world that make a living in the sport. The other 55 pay there bills and buy and work on their bikes themselves.

I’m starting to think about go MotoGP. And hope I could fulfill Casey Stoner’s shoes ones day. Or Mick Doohan.

What do you think?
